overview: From 2025-07-03 to 2025-07-04, elizaos/eliza had 28 new PRs (23 merged), 7 new issues, and 11 active contributors.

topIssues.title: Client hot reloads in dev
topIssues.author: lalalune
topIssues.body: Right now we have to rebuild and restart to see any UI changes, would be really nice to have hot reload

topIssues.title: Dependency Loop in local ai plugin
topIssues.author: omariosman
topIssues.body:
After `elizaos create` I chose to use local ai.
However when I do `elizaos start` I encounter this error:
```
error: Package "@elizaos/plugin-local-ai@github:elizaos-plugins/plugin-local-ai#2dad17e" has a dependency loop
  Resolution: "@elizaos/plugin-local-ai@1.0.0"
  Dependency: "@elizaos/plugin-local-ai@github:elizaos-plugins/plugin-local-ai#v1.0.0"
error: An internal error occurred (DependencyLoop)

ERROR: Failed to install plugin @elizaos/plugin-local-ai
WARN: Failed to load plugin module '@elizaos/plugin-local-ai' using all available strategies
```

topIssues.title: Plugin migration - hybrid approach - AI + Manually
topIssues.author: samarth30

topPRs.title: feat: Add comprehensive CLI testing infrastructure
topPRs.author: SYMBaiEX
topPRs.body:
## Summary

This PR implements a comprehensive testing infrastructure for the ElizaOS CLI, addressing issue #5325. The new testing framework provides automated validation of CLI commands, documentation consistency checks, performance monitoring, and integration testing capabilities.

**Key Features:**
- Automated CLI command validation against documentation
- Performance testing for CLI responsiveness
- Error handling validation for graceful failures
- Integration with existing Bun test framework
- Documentation parsing and consistency validation

## Changes

### New Testing Infrastructure

#### Test Utilities (`tests/utils/`)
- **`cli-test-runner.ts`**: Core test runner with command execution, timeout handling, and output validation
- **`documentation-parser.ts`**: Parses and validates CLI documentation from multiple sources (Markdown, TypeScript, JSON)

#### Test Suites
- **`tests/commands/cli-validation.test.ts`**: 
  - CLI infrastructure tests (version, help, executable validation)
  - Core command validation (create, test, start, plugins)
  - Documentation consistency checks
  - Error handling tests
  - Performance benchmarks

- **`tests/integration/cli-integration.test.ts`**:
  - Project creation scenarios
  - Plugin management workflows
  - Agent runtime validation
  - Complex multi-command sequences

#### Test Setup & Execution
- **`tests/setup/test-setup.ts`**: Environment setup utilities for CI/CD integration
- **`tests/cli-test-runner.ts`**: Custom test execution framework
- **`tests/run-cli-tests.sh`**: Shell script for comprehensive test execution

### Documentation
- **`CLI-COMMANDS.md`**: Comprehensive CLI command documentation for validation

### Package Updates
- Added new test scripts to `package.json`:
  - `test:cli-validation`: Run CLI validation tests
  - `test:cli-integration`: Run integration tests
  - `test:cli-runner`: Execute custom test runner
  - `test:cli-all`: Run complete CLI test suite

## Test Results

All tests are passing with 100% success rate:

```
✅ CLI Validation Tests: 18/18 passing
✅ Core Infrastructure: Validated
✅ Documentation Consistency: Verified
✅ Error Handling: Graceful failures confirmed
✅ Performance: Sub-5 second response times
```

## Benefits

1. **Automated Validation**: Ensures CLI commands work as expected
2. **Documentation Accuracy**: Validates help text matches available commands
3. **Regression Prevention**: Catches CLI breakages before deployment
4. **Performance Monitoring**: Tracks CLI response times
5. **CI/CD Ready**: Integrates with existing testing pipelines

## Testing

To run the new CLI tests:

```bash
# Run CLI validation tests
bun run test:cli-validation

# Run integration tests
bun run test:cli-integration

# Run all CLI tests
bun run test:cli-all
```

## Related Issues

Resolves #5325: CLI testing infrastructure for automated validation

## Checklist

- [x] Tests pass locally
- [x] Code follows project style guidelines
- [x] Documentation updated
- [x] No breaking changes
- [x] Ready for review

topPRs.title: fix: implement plugin dependency resolution for CLI (Issue #4997)
topPRs.author: SYMBaiEX
topPRs.body:
## Summary

This PR fixes issue #4997 where the CLI does not properly load/register dependencies from plugins. The implementation adds automatic dependency checking and installation for plugins during CLI startup and test execution.

## Changes

- Added `plugin-dependency-manager.ts` utility with functions to:
  - Check for missing plugin dependencies (regular, peer, and optional)
  - Install missing dependencies automatically
  - Validate plugin dependencies before loading
  - Perform security validation on package names and versions
  
- Integrated dependency management into:
  - `start` command: Checks and installs dependencies when loading plugins
  - `test` command: Validates dependencies before running plugin tests
  
- Added comprehensive test coverage:
  - 34 unit tests covering all functionality
  - Integration tests for end-to-end scenarios
  - 100% line coverage achieved

## Security Features

The implementation includes security validation to prevent installation of malicious packages:
- Package name validation against npm naming conventions
- Version string format validation
- Detection of suspicious package names (e.g., `sudo`, `rm`, `backdoor`)
- Refusal to install packages that fail security checks

## Technical Notes

- Removed redundant security check that was unreachable code (improved from 98.92% to 100% coverage)
- ElizaOS packages (starting with `@elizaos/`) are automatically skipped as they should already be available
- Optional dependencies are installed but failures are non-fatal
- Peer dependencies include helpful guidance for manual installation if needed

## Test Coverage

```
File                                     < /dev/null |  % Funcs | % Lines | Uncovered Line #s
----------------------------------------|---------|---------|-------------------
src/utils/plugin-dependency-manager.ts  |  100.00 |  100.00 | 
```

## Testing

1. Create a plugin with npm dependencies
2. Run `elizaos start` without pre-installing the dependencies
3. The CLI should automatically detect and install missing dependencies
4. Plugin should load successfully

Fixes #4997

topPRs.title: fix(plugin-sql): add database migration advisory locking for horizontal scaling
topPRs.author: SYMBaiEX
topPRs.body:
## Summary

Implements advisory locking mechanism to prevent concurrent database migrations that could lead to corruption or errors when multiple ElizaOS instances start simultaneously in horizontally scaled environments.

Fixes #5181

## Problem

When ElizaOS is deployed in horizontally scaled environments (Kubernetes, server clusters), multiple instances starting simultaneously may attempt to run migrations at the same time, causing:
- Race conditions around table/constraint creation
- PostgreSQL errors such as "relation already exists"
- Partial or inconsistent schema state if migrations fail mid-way

## Solution

This PR introduces a robust migration locking mechanism that ensures only one instance can run migrations at a time:

### Key Features
- **PostgreSQL Advisory Locks**: Uses `pg_advisory_lock` for efficient, automatic cleanup
- **Fallback Table-Based Locking**: For databases without advisory lock support
- **Migration History Tracking**: Prevents re-running completed migrations
- **Stale Lock Cleanup**: Handles crashed processes gracefully
- **Configurable Timeout**: Default 60 seconds with automatic retry

### Implementation Details

1. **MigrationLockManager** class:
   - Acquires/releases locks using PostgreSQL advisory locks when available
   - Falls back to table-based locking for other databases
   - Tracks lock ownership with process info (PID@hostname)
   - Cleans up stale locks from crashed processes

2. **Migration History Table**:
   - Records all executed migrations with timestamps
   - Stores schema checksums to detect version changes
   - Tracks both successful and failed migrations

3. **Updated DatabaseMigrationService**:
   - Wraps all migration operations with lock acquisition
   - Ensures proper lock release even on failure
   - Works for both core system and plugin migrations

## Testing

Added comprehensive test coverage including:
- Unit tests for MigrationLockManager (100% coverage)
- Integration tests simulating concurrent migration attempts
- Edge case handling (timeouts, stale locks, failures)

## Deployment Benefits

This implementation enables safe deployment in:
- Multi-instance startup scenarios
- Auto-scaling environments
- Rolling updates
- Zero-downtime deployments

## Technical Notes

- Uses SHA256 hashing to generate deterministic lock IDs
- Non-blocking lock attempts with configurable retry logic
- Maintains compatibility with existing Drizzle migration system
- No changes required to existing plugins - works automatically

## Future Enhancements

While not required for this issue, potential future improvements could include:
- Deferred readiness in health endpoints during migrations
- Configurable `lock_timeout` and `statement_timeout` for PostgreSQL
- Exponential backoff in retry logic

---

The implementation follows PostgreSQL best practices for advisory locking and has been tested to ensure it properly serializes migration execution across multiple instances.
